00006 // from solution 2 of the file ~/src/include/cast-const.txt.

00011 #ifndef __TEMPLATES_HH
00012 #define __TEMPLATES_HH
00013 
00014 // Protected Linked List
00015 //
00016 // A linked list with protection against breakage and floating remnants,
00017 // which is also type-safe by using define to create type-specific
00018 // code instead of type-casting from generic code.
00019 // The two classes that are created for each class that uses
00020 // this Protected Linked List template are declared as friends
00021 // of each other, to simplify intuitive processes for such tasks
00022 // as linking and unlinking, without granting any private access to
00023 // either the class using the Protected Linked List template or
00024 // any classes derived from the two additional created classes,
00025 // thereby effectively guarding the link structure against
00026 // changes that could violate the protocol.
00027 /* Schematic of the structure:
00028 
00029    +----+     +----+     +----+     +----+
00030    |obj1|     |obj2|     |obj3|     |obj4|
00031    |inh.|     |inh.|     |inh.|     |inh.|
00032    |PLL |     |PLL |     |PLL |     |PLL |
00033    +----+ next+----+     +----+     +----+
00034 +->|PLL1|<--->|PLL2|<--->|PLL3|<--->|PLL4|<-+
00035 |  +----+prev +----+     +----+     +----+  |
00036 |     \          \         /          /     |   PLL and
00037 |      \__________\_______/__________/      |   PLLRoot
00038 |           root      |                     |   are
00039 |                     v                     |   friends
00040 |         head  +-----------+  tail         |
00041 +---------------|  PLLRoot  |---------------+
00042                 +-----------+
00043                      ### (local, global or new-allocated)
00044         +----------------------------+
00045         | class, function or program |
00046         +----------------------------+
00047 
00048 */
00049 
00050 // a - Protected Linked List class and its Root class, add these
00051 //     above the class header
00052 
00053 template <class PLLType> class PLLRoot;
00054 template <class PLLType>
00055 // <A NAME="PLLHandle"></A>
00056 class PLLHandle { 
00057         friend PLLRoot<PLLType>;
00058         //template<class PLLType> friend PLLRoot; 
00059         protected: 
00060                 PLLRoot<PLLType> * pllroot; 
00061                 PLLType * pllnext, * pllprev; 
00062                 PLLHandle(): pllroot(NULL), pllnext(NULL), pllprev(NULL) {} 
00063                 virtual ~PLLHandle() {
00064                         // If pllroot calls deletion, delete from here onwards.
00065                         // If un unexpected source calls deletion (e.g. if this element
00066                         // was a local object that is destructed) then unlink and
00067                         // delete.
00068                 cerr << "PLLH-D, this = " << (int) this << ", pllroot = " << (int) pllroot << ','; cerr.flush();
00069                 delete pllnext;
00070                  } // virtual destructor calls actual complete most-derived object's destructor first
00071         public: 
00072                 PLLRoot<PLLType> * Root() const { return pllroot; } 
00073                 PLLType * Next() const { return pllnext; } 
00074                 PLLType * Prev() const { return pllprev; } 
00075                 PLLType * head() const { return pllroot->head(); } 
00076                 PLLType * tail() const { return pllroot->tail(); } 
00077                 inline PLLType * el(int n) const; 
00078                 inline PLLType * seek_head() const; 
00079                 inline PLLType * seek_tail() const; 
00080                 inline int length() const; 
00081                 inline int fulllength() const; 
00082                 inline bool unlink_before(PLLRoot<PLLType> & succ); 
00083                 inline bool unlink_after(PLLRoot<PLLType> & pred); 
00084                 inline void remove(); 
00085 };
00086 
00087 template <class PLLType>
00088 class PLLRoot { 
00089         friend PLLHandle<PLLType>; 
00090         //template<class PLLType> friend PLLHandle; 
00091         protected: 
00092                 PLLType * pllhead; 
00093                 PLLType * plltail; 
00094                 inline void set_root(PLLType * h); 
00095         public: 
00096 /* *** Deletion issues:
00097 (1) Should probably avoid deleting pllhead that is already deleted.
00098 (2) Should perhaps enable deletion of a root without deletion of the list, if
00099     it is possible to have multiple roots pointing at the list.
00100 (3) Check unlink behaviour.
00101 (4) What are virtual destructors used for?
00102 */
00103                 ~PLLRoot() { 
00104                 cerr << "PLLR-D, this = " << (int) this << ", pllhead = " << (int) pllhead << ','; cerr.flush();
00105                 delete pllhead; } // *** perhaps also make this virtual, but delete is not usually called on a PLLRoot<PLLType> object
00106                 PLLRoot(): pllhead(NULL), plltail(NULL) {} 
00107                 PLLType * head() const { return pllhead; } 
00108                 PLLType * tail() const { return plltail; } 
00109                 PLLType * el(int n) const { if (pllhead) return pllhead->el(n); return NULL; } 
00110                 PLLType * operator[](int n) const { return el(n); } 
00111                 int length() const { if (pllhead) return pllhead->length(); return 0; } 
00112                 inline void update(); 
00113                 inline bool link_before(PLLRoot * succ); 
00114                 inline bool link_before(PLLType * succ); 
00115                 inline bool link_after(PLLRoot * pred); 
00116                 inline bool link_after(PLLType * pred); 
00117                 inline bool insert_after(PLLType * pred, PLLType * inshead); 
00118                 inline bool insert_after(int n, PLLType * inshead); 
00119                 inline bool insert_before(PLLType * succ, PLLType * inshead); 
00120                 inline bool insert_before(int n, PLLType * inshead);
00121                 // *** if the clear() function is for some reason too
00122                 //     drastic, it can be rewritten as follows to require
00123                 //     subsequent manual deletion:
00124                 // PLLRoot<PLLType> * clear() { PLLRoot<PLLType> * clearroot = new PLLRoot<PLLType>; if (pllhead) pllhead->unlink_before(clearroot); return clearroot; }
00125                 void clear() { delete pllhead; pllhead = NULL; plltail = NULL; }
00126 };
00127 
00128 // b - Protected Linked List inheritance, add this into the list
00129 //     of inherited classes: public PLLHandle<PLLType>
00130 
00131 // c - Protected Linked List inline functions
00132 //     Note that the static_cast<>()s used below are safe, since
00133 //     it is assured through the creation mechanisms of PLLHandle<PLLType>
00134 //     and PLLRoot<PLLType> that all elements are of the derived class
00135 //     PLLType with base PLLHandle<PLLType>. Also see corresponding
00136 //     <A HREF="../../nnmodels/nnmodels.html">notes</A>.
00137 //     Addendum: The use of static_cast<>() is now avoided as much as
00138 //     possible, since it should not be necessary if the code is
00139 //     properly programmed.
00140 
00141 template <class PLLType>
00142 inline bool PLLHandle<PLLType>::unlink_before(PLLRoot<PLLType> & succ) { 
00143 // unlinks before this and gives this and after
00144 // the new root succ
00145 // succ is currently required to be an empty list
00146         if (succ.head()) return false; 
00147         if (pllprev) pllprev->pllnext = NULL; 
00148  /* *** At this location the simple solution of PLLType * pllnext, etc. does not work.
00149         Using this method, it was necessary to resort to old-style C casting. */
00150         succ.pllhead = (PLLType *) this; 
00151         if (pllroot) { 
00152                 succ.plltail = pllroot->tail(); 
00153                 pllroot->plltail = pllprev; 
00154                 if (!pllprev) pllroot->pllhead = NULL; 
00155         } else succ.plltail = seek_tail(); 
00156         pllprev = NULL; 
00157  /* *** At this location the simple solution of PLLType * pllnext, etc. does not work.
00158         Using this method, it was necessary to resort to old-style C casting. */
00159         succ.set_root((PLLType *) this); 
00160         return true; 
00161 } 
00162 
00163 template <class PLLType>
00164 inline bool PLLHandle<PLLType>::unlink_after(PLLRoot<PLLType> & pred) { 
00165 // unlinks after this and gives this and before
00166 // the new root pred
00167 // pred is currently required to be an empty list
00168         if (pred.head()) return false; 
00169         if (pllnext) pllnext->pllprev = NULL; 
00170  /* *** At this location the simple solution of PLLType * pllnext, etc. does not work.
00171         Using this method, it was necessary to resort to old-style C casting. */
00172         pred.plltail = (PLLType *) this; 
00173         if (pllroot) { 
00174                 pred.pllhead = pllroot->head(); 
00175                 pllroot->pllhead = pllnext; 
00176                 if (!pllnext) pllroot->plltail = NULL; 
00177         } else pred.pllhead = seek_head(); 
00178         pllnext = NULL; 
00179         pred.set_root(pred.head()); 
00180         return true; 
00181 } 
00182 
00183 template <class PLLType>
00184 inline void PLLHandle<PLLType>::remove() { 
00185 // unlink and delete Protected Linked List element
00186 // and update head and tail
00187         if (!pllroot) { 
00188                 pllprev->pllnext = pllnext; 
00189                 pllnext->pllprev = pllprev; 
00190                 PLLType * pn = pllnext; 
00191                 delete this;
00192                 return;
00193         } 
00194         PLLRoot<PLLType> * h = pllroot, r, t; 
00195         unlink_before(t); 
00196         unlink_after(r); 
00197         h->link_before(&t); // deletion occurs as r and t are destroyed
00198 } 
00199 
00200 template <class PLLType>
00201 inline PLLType * PLLHandle<PLLType>::el(int n) const {
00202  /* *** At this location the simple solution of PLLType * pllnext, etc. does not work.
00203         Using this method, it was necessary to resort to old-style C casting. */
00204         if (!n) return (PLLType *) this;
00205         if (n>0) { 
00206                 if (pllnext) return pllnext->el(n-1); 
00207                 else return NULL; 
00208         } else { 
00209                 if (pllprev) return pllprev->el(n+1); 
00210                 else return NULL; 
00211         } 
00212 } 
00213 
00214 template <class PLLType>
00215 inline PLLType * PLLHandle<PLLType>::seek_head() const { 
00216  /* *** At this location the simple solution of PLLType * pllnext, etc. does not work.
00217         Using this method, it was necessary to resort to old-style C casting. */
00218         if (!pllprev) return (PLLType *) this;
00219         return pllprev->seek_head(); 
00220 } 
00221 
00222 template <class PLLType>
00223 inline PLLType * PLLHandle<PLLType>::seek_tail() const { 
00224  /* *** At this location the simple solution of PLLType * pllnext, etc. does not work.
00225         Using this method, it was necessary to resort to old-style C casting. */
00226         if (!pllnext) return (PLLType *) this; 
00227         return pllnext->seek_tail(); 
00228 } 
00229 
00230 template <class PLLType>
00231 inline int PLLHandle<PLLType>::length() const { 
00232         if (Next()) return 1 + Next()->length(); 
00233         return 1; 
00234 } 
00235 
00236 template <class PLLType>
00237 inline int PLLHandle<PLLType>::fulllength() const { 
00238         return head()->length(); 
00239 } 
00240 
00241 template <class PLLType>
00242 inline void PLLRoot<PLLType>::set_root(PLLType * h) { 
00243         for (; (h); h = h->Next()) h->pllroot = this; 
00244 } 
00245 
00246 template <class PLLType>
00247 inline void PLLRoot<PLLType>::update() { 
00248 // clears head and tail if elements were linked to another root
00249 // or fixes head and tail if either one pointed to an element with
00250 // a different root
00251         if (pllhead) if (pllhead->Root()!=this) pllhead = NULL; 
00252         if (plltail) { 
00253                 if (plltail->Root()!=this) { 
00254                         if (!pllhead) plltail = NULL; 
00255                         else plltail = pllhead->seek_tail(); 
00256                 } else { 
00257                         if (!pllhead) pllhead = plltail->seek_head(); 
00258                 } 
00259         } 
00260 } 
00261 
00262 template <class PLLType>
00263 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::link_before(PLLRoot<PLLType> * succ) { 
00264         if (!succ) return false; 
00265         if (!succ->head()) return false; 
00266         // *** could call update() here first to insure that pllhead and plltail
00267         //     are correct
00268         if (plltail) { 
00269                 plltail->pllnext = succ->head(); 
00270                 succ->head()->pllprev = plltail; 
00271         } else pllhead = succ->head(); 
00272         plltail = succ->tail(); 
00273         set_root(succ->head()); 
00274         succ->update(); 
00275         return true; 
00276 } 
00277 
00278 template <class PLLType>
00279 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::link_before(PLLType * succ) { 
00280 // when succ->Root()==NULL, this allows previously
00281 // unprotected lists or newly created PLLType elements
00282 // to be linked
00283         if (!succ) return false; 
00284         if (succ->Root()) return link_before(succ->Root()); 
00285         if (plltail) { 
00286                 plltail->pllnext = succ;
00287                 succ->pllprev = plltail; 
00288         } else pllhead = succ; 
00289         plltail = succ; // *** this may need to be succ->seek_tail(), unless lists without root cannot exist
00290         set_root(succ); 
00291         return true; 
00292 } 
00293 
00294 template <class PLLType>
00295 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::link_after(PLLRoot<PLLType> * pred) { 
00296         if (!pred) return false; 
00297         if (!pred->tail()) return false; 
00298         // *** could call update() here first to insure that pllhead and plltail
00299         //     are correct
00300         if (pllhead) { 
00301                 pllhead->pllprev = pred->tail(); 
00302                 pred->tail()->pllnext = pllhead; 
00303         } else plltail = pred->head(); 
00304         pllhead = pred->head(); 
00305         set_root(pred->head()); 
00306         pred->update(); 
00307         return true; 
00308 }
00309 
00310 template <class PLLType>
00311 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::link_after(PLLType * pred) { 
00312 // when succ->Root()==NULL, this allows previously
00313 // unprotected lists or newly created PLLType elements
00314 // to be linked
00315         if (!pred) return false; 
00316         if (pred->Root()) return link_after(pred->Root()); 
00317         if (pllhead) { 
00318                 pllhead->pllprev = pred; 
00319                 pred->pllnext = pllhead; 
00320         } else plltail = pred; 
00321         pllhead = pred;  // *** this may need to be pred->seek_head(), unless lists without root cannot exist
00322         set_root(pred); 
00323         return true; 
00324 }
00325 
00326 template <class PLLType>
00327 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::insert_after(PLLType * pred, PLLType * inshead) {
00328 // inserts inshead after element pred in this list
00329 // if pred==NULL or pred->Root()!=this, inserts at tail of list
00330         if (!pred) return link_before(inshead); // link inshead to tail of this
00331         if (pred->Root()!=this) return link_before(inshead); // link inshead to tail of this
00332         PLLRoot<PLLType> h;
00333         pred->unlink_after(h); // get head of list up to pred into h
00334         bool res = h.link_before(inshead); // link inshead to tail of h
00335         link_after(&h); // link h to head of this
00336         return res;
00337 } 
00338 
00339 template <class PLLType>
00340 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::insert_after(int n, PLLType * inshead) {
00341 // inserts inshead after the nth element in this list
00342 // if nth element does not exist, inserts at tail of list
00343         PLLType * pred = el(n);
00344         return insert_after(pred,inshead);
00345 } 
00346 
00347 template <class PLLType>
00348 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::insert_before(PLLType * succ, PLLType * inshead) {
00349 // inserts inshead before element succ in this list
00350 // if succ==NULL or succ->Root()!=this, inserts at head of list
00351         if (!succ) return link_after(inshead); // link inshead to head of this
00352         if (succ->Root()!=this) return link_after(inshead); // link inshead to head of this
00353         PLLRoot<PLLType> t;
00354         succ->unlink_before(t); // get tail of list from succ into t
00355         bool res = t.link_after(inshead); // link inshead to head of t
00356         link_before(&t); // link t to tail of this
00357         return res;
00358 } 
00359 
00360 template <class PLLType>
00361 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::insert_before(int n, PLLType * inshead) {
00362 // inserts inshead before the nth element in this list
00363 // if nth element does not exist, inserts at head of list
00364         PLLType * succ = el(n);
00365         return insert_before(succ,inshead);
00366 }

00368 // d - Protected Linked List macro that can be used to
00369 //     access functions in linked elements at a relative
00370 //     distance n from an element
00371 #define Protected_Linked_List_Indexed_Access(PLLType,Here,There) \
00372         if (!n) return Here; \
00373         if (PLLType * e = el(n)) return e->There; else return NULL \
00374 
00375 // e - Protected Linked List macro that loops forward through
00376 //     linked elements contingent upon a test, providing the
00377 //     pointer e to the current element
00378 #define PLL_LOOP_FORWARD(PLLType,Init_El,Extra_Test) \
00379         for (PLLType * e = Init_El; ((e) && (Extra_Test)); e = e->Next())
00380 
00381 // f - Protected Linked List macro that loops forward through
00382 //     linked elements contingent upon a test, providing the
00383 //     pointer to the current element in a specified variable
00384 //     to enable nesting of PLL_LOOP_FORWARD_NESTED calls
00385 #define PLL_LOOP_FORWARD_NESTED(PLLType,Init_El,Extra_Test,RefVar) \
00386         for (PLLType * RefVar = Init_El; ((RefVar) && (Extra_Test)); RefVar = RefVar->Next())
